article_text:
One of the big, if not often explicit, Republican debates this year is how the party can best reclaim the White House and a new conservative political majority. Will it be enough to ride the obvious wave of voter frustration and anger, or does the GOP also need to offer a more optimistic agenda that broadens its appeal?

The former attitude has dominated the presidential nomination debating, but the latter was on stage Saturday in South Carolina at a forum sponsored by the foundation named after the late, great Republican...

twitter.description: Some in the GOP are looking for a new anti-poverty agenda, the Wall Street Journal says in an editorial.
twitter.title: The Other Republican Campaign
